page.title: 03PILLEY IN BOLDRE PARISH
page.content: The boundary between Boldre and Pilley is hard to define.The villages are part of each other and form a spread out,looseknit community.From the poor to the rich,from young couples with families to plan for to the retired seeking to maintain the status quo it is sometimes hard to find common agreement and factions do arise. The Fleur de Lys pub dates from the 13th century,the village hall is a memorial to the fallen of the 1st world war,the school was one of the earliest of its kind,the W.I. started in 1917 and the championship Tug of War Team is nearly as old,the village is concious of the past.There is a demand for housing for the young and though this is a difficult problem to resolve,the future,it is plain,also matters to Pilley/Boldre.
